text:
hey everyone welcome to Pai's kitchen today I am 
making a matcha caramel pudding which is another

recipe inspired by my recent trip to Japan and 
if you recall if you saw that video I had this

delightful cream caramel and there was also a 
lot of matcha consumed during that trip and so

it occurred to me that you know these two flavors 
would go really well together but I also wanted

to make a very simple recipe so I am doing a 
no-bake version that is really as simple as

it gets so let's get started so the first thing 
we're gonna make is the caramel portion of this

which is very simple I'm gonna make a wet caramel 
just plain old sugar to make it wet I'm gonna add

some water just enough there's no specific amount 
of water you need just enough to wet it so like

a couple tablespoons is fine now I'm gonna just 
turn the stove on to about medium heat and just

let that dissolve and slowly turn into a beautiful 
caramel color so wow that's heating up let's look

at my little containers now depending on whether 
you want to unmold it you can choose your things

accordingly so this I can't unmold anything out 
of it because the top is narrower so this is like

a eat in the jar kind of thing but this will be 
perfect for unmolding cuz it will come out the

top is wider I'm gonna put some hot water on the 
bottom and I want to keep these hot so that when

I pour the caramel the caramel doesn't harden so 
quickly okay and rule of thumb for making caramels

you try not to stir it because thering encourage 
just crystallization I personally have never had

that problem even when I do Surratt's but it's 
always safe to take that precaution so swirling

is a gentler way if you've got sugar stuck to the 
sides of the pot after you swirl you just take a

brush that's wet with water and just brush it down 
and how dark you'd make this caramels completely

up to you I like mine quite dark as I like that 
intense flavor but right here some of you may

like it just like that I like to push it darker I 
like the way that looks this is just dark enough

for me so now I'm gonna quickly pour this into 
my containers careful do not get your hands on

this stuff like I'm telling you this is gonna be 
the worst kind of burn you experience touch more

here yeah that looks good since this is a no-bake 
pudding what are we gonna use to set it if not

cooked eggs that's right gelatin so I've got here 
some powdered gelatin and I'm just gonna sprinkle

this first onto some water and you always want to 
do this when working with gelatin because gelatin

needs time to bloom as they call it basically 
that means it hydrates absorbs a bunch of water

and you don't want to pile it all into one big 
pile because otherwise you get a pocket in the

middle that doesn't have access to water now 
that's gonna need maybe 10-15 minutes so we'll

let that go so I've got some milk over here I'm 
just using 2% because it's what I drinks what I

have in the fridge you can also do whole milk 
but whatever you do do not do skim milk people

now is not the time for low fat when I just whoo 
now to enrich it a little bit I'm gonna add some

whipping cream and the ratio of whipping cream to 
radial milk is sort of up to you you can make it

richer and add more and make it lighter not less 
and then for sweetness I'm gonna add condensed

milk because we get sweetness and extra milky 
goodness why not right you could just do sugar

but hey I'm Asian and as Asians love our condensed 
milk a tiny little smidge of salt to balance out

the sweetness and because this is milk you want 
to be stirring otherwise you sometimes you know

you get that milk protein cooked and stuck to 
the bottom of the pot if you keep stirring you

won't get that all right so it's steaming now I'm 
just gonna turn off the heat let me get my matcha

in there so matcha is basically green tea powder 
okay you can get it at lots of different stores

health food stores Asian grocery stores but the 
thing is it's very clumpy so you need to sifted

into the milk to make it a little bit easier 
for you to get everything dissolved if you're

actually using granulated sugar what you could do 
is mix the matcha with the sugar to break up all

of the lumps stir that in and spend a little bit 
of time whisking just to make sure all the lumps

are dissolved if you get tiny little lumps that's 
fine we're gonna strain it one more time anyway

what I should have done was sift a little bit 
whisk a little bit and then sift a little more

and whisk a little bit more but oh well and now 
the gelatin which has completely like absorbed

all the water just add all of that in bloop and 
that's it now if this is your first time making

I would taste for sweetness I don't make this 
very sweet for myself because there's gonna be

caramel as well but if you like it sweeter you 
may want to add a little more sugar a little

more condensed milk so now I'm gonna transfer this 
into a pouring container because trust me that's

gonna make it easier and you definitely want to 
strain this to make sure there are no lumps of

much at left okay and one thing to note about 
matcha - it doesn't actually dissolve dissolve

because these are like powder tea leaves right so 
the leaves themselves are not going to liquefy so

you'll always get little grains and that is not a 
cause for concern that is just the way it is it's

actually cool because it's gonna create layers 
because once the Leafs settle to the bottom it'll

create layers which makes it extra cool and now 
we'll get that into our little cups one thing you

do want to do while you pour is stir it because 
again the much settles at the bottom do I have

enough for one more see I don't even have enough 
for that one this is the first time I've made

this recipe with these particular combinations of 
moles so I didn't really know exactly how much I

would need I have an idea AHA now you want these 
to chill in the fridge preferably overnight they

might set within a few hours but what you want 
also is to give the caramel time to dissolve

if you get it out as soon as it's chilled you'll 
find that only some of the caramels dissolved in

the bottom was still gonna be really hard if you 
do it tomorrow then you'll get more liquid caramel

that you can access so here are my puddings 
as you can see I have some wrinkles on four

of them and this is actually the first time it's 
ever happened to me and my theory is that it was

quite hot when I poured it in the cup and I put 
it directly in the fridge didn't happen to this

one so that's why I'm thinking it's temperature 
cuz by the time there was only this much left it

cooled down a lot but either case doesn't matter 
because we're either going to unmold it or we're

gonna garnish it with stuff on top now we are 
rushing it a little bit because I'm filming and

I do make any in advance I don't know if this will 
be ready to unmold but we're gonna find out oh but

before that check out this gradient because as I 
said green tea doesn't actually dissolve when you

put in the fridge it'll kind of slowly settle to 
the bottom and as it said to kind of catch just

some mid like journey and every time I've made 
this it's created a different pattern so it's

kind of cool to see like what's it gonna look like 
this time okay so if you want to unmold it what

you want to do dip this into the hot water and 
then you feel it like you just feel it I twist

it around and you'll see that it's loose now it's 
not stuck to the glass anymore see if I was more

organized I'd have ones ready to go for you and 
flip oh it's still kind of holding oh there you

go it's holding oh and it jiggles I just love 
doing this it's just so fun I mean as you can

see though because I rushed it I still have a bit 
of caramel stuck to the bottom that hasn't had a

chance to dissolve if you give it enough time all 
of that will be liquefied but hey that worked out

pretty cool look how cute that is right if you 
don't want to unmold it which is generally what

I like to do just for the sake of simplicity this 
is how I suggest you garnish it so you take a tiny

little bit of whipping cream in a tiny little 
picture preferably and then what this does is it

sort of adds to that gradient I also have some red 
bean paste so this is sweetened rest red bee pase

then you can just get already finished from like 
a Japanese grocery store yeah red bean and green

tea is just a flavor match made in heaven look 
at that for really beautiful layers and you want

to make sure you dig all the way through to the 
bottom to release some of that caramel oh yes all

the perfect amount of creaminess melts immediately 
in your mouth that caramel flavor nice and intense

and then you get the texture from the red bean I'm 
telling you if you are a fan of green tea this is

it cannot go wrong can you tell I'm hungry so the 
recipe as always will be on Pais kitchen calm when

you make it send me a photo on Facebook Twitter 
or Instagram I am also on Pinterest now for those

of you pinners and if you haven't subscribed to 
the show make sure you do so you don't miss an

awesome recipe like this and click that little 
bell icon so you get a notification when I post

a new video if you love the show and you want 
to support us check out our patreon link in the

description below and I will see you next 
time for your next delicious adventure you
